'Adequality' (Latin: adaequalitas) is a mathematical term introduced by Pierre
de Fermat, which, roughly speaking, means equating things that are different
(the exact meaning subject to controversy; see below). As a mathematical
concept, this term had been used by Fermat and his followers, but fell into
disuse from the 18th century onward.

Adequality has been reintroduced by modern historians of mathematics to name
Fermat's method of computing maxima, minima and tangents, and to discuss the
exact meaning of the word in Fermat's work. The word adaequalitas has given the
